intro: Desmodium asperum var. guaraniticum, commonly known as the Brazilian burr legume, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant produces small, hairy pods that contain several seeds, and it is often found in disturbed soils and grasslands. It has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. The species is also valued for its role in soil nitrogen fixation and as a forage plant for livestock.
